column5: we have gone through two web cams that don't really work on our computer.  Either the camera works and not the microphone or vice-versa.  Does anyone have any good success stories with these things?  Are they all lemons?  We run windows XP and that is all I know.

Yup,got the same problemo...Camera/mike seems to work when I test it but then I go to MSN the mike portion doesn't seem to kick in....So,I turn off the mike on the webcam and use a head set with a mike when I'm on MSN instead....I'm also running XP  Cheers !!

I am using a  Logitech QuickCam Communicate STX and I don't have any complaints.  Takes great video and it is easy to send video as an email.  Sometimes my window locks up but that is only when I use full screen viewing(Full Screen Picture).  I am fairly sure that all I need to do is add more memory to my computer to solve that problem.  Tom
Yup i have the logitech too....Use it to talk to my family across the big pond quiet often on weekend's & never had a problem with it.
Steve,Ihave one to never used it so have no clue wether mine works or not.Willing to try some time bud. youFF#1.  Steve,
I have had a few of em... and never had a problem... what software are you trying to use it with?  Ger.
I have a Logitech cheapie that's probably 6 or 7 years old. It's worked fine with several different computers and operating systems.

I've always used logitech or Creative - never had trouble, sometimes you gotta shell out a few more bucks to make sure you get a good one.  My last one was 99$  Make sure you donwload the lates software for your caam before using it
If I was you I would be looking at the wide angle lens cam....
